title: JPMorgan employee who questioned Jamie Dimon’s RTO mandate says he was fired—then told he could stay—after testy town hall
description: Worker who questioned Jamie Dimon’s RTO mandate says he was fired—then told he could keep his job—after testy town hall exchange
author: Luisa Beltran
excerpt: Nicolas Welch is one of the JPM employees who are objecting to the company ending hybrid work.
text: Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, leaves the U.S. Capitol after a meeting with Republican members of the Senate Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs Committee on the issue of debanking on Thursday, February 13, 2025. (Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images)Tom Williams—CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images
html:
Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, leaves the U.S. Capitol after a meeting with Republican members of the Senate Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs Committee on the issue of debanking on Thursday, February 13, 2025. (Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images)

Tom Williams—CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images
